docs.title: Welcome to Discord!
docs.text:
Welcome to our BCIT student community on Discord! Whether you're here to collaborate on projects, connect with classmates, complain about instructors(hopefully not), or simply unwind after a long day of studying, Discord provides the platform for communication and collaboration.

This user document is designed to help you navigate your way through the web version of Discord, based on the current version as of March 5, 2024. From setting up your first server, streaming videos with friends, and making customized stickers and emojis. By the end of this guide, you'll be equipped with the knowledge to seamlessly integrate Discord into your student life.

Let's dive in and explore the exciting world of Discord together!

docs.title: Intended Users
docs.text: This guide is intended for students at BCIT who are new to Discord and wish to learn how to utilize its features for academic and social purposes.

docs.title: Prerequisite
docs.text:
Before proceeding, ensure you have the following:

  • a Discord Account, if not click here to go to create a Discord Account

docs.title: Procedures Overview
docs.text:
1. Add Friends To Your Server: Learn how to create and customize your own Discord server.

  2. Start activities with Friends: Discover how to watch videos together and play games with your friends using Discord's streaming feature.

  3. Make Customized Stickers and Emojis: Explore how to personalize your Discord experience by creating and using custom stickers and emojis.

Now, let's get started by creating your Discord.🚀 Click here to go to Discord

docs.title: Glossary
docs.text: Terms Definition Activity A shared interactive experience on Discord, such as watching videos or playing games together within a voice or video channel. Avatar Discord avatar is a small graphical image, equivalent to a profile picture Channel Channels are organized into text and voice channels, which are usually dedicated to specific topics and can have different rules. Text channels: Specialized for posting messages, upload files, and share images for others to see at any time. Voice channels: Specialized for voice or video call in real time, and sharing screen with friends - also known as Go Live. Discord Discord is a voice or text communication platform specializes in text, image, video, and audio communication Emoji Emojis are tiny pictures you can drop into your messages. Nitro Discord’s premium subscription service with features such as unlimited use of custom emojis, access to a library of games, and higher quality video streams Role A set of permissions or settings that can be applied to server members, often used to manage access or moderation capabilities. Server Server is a chatroom with channels inside. You can create a server by tapping the + button on the left bar Server Template Pre-defined settings and structures provided by Discord to simplify the creation of new servers, tailored for specific purposes like gaming, study groups, or clubs. Sticker Stickers are pictures that can be used in a text channel or voice channel. They appear similarly to emojis, but are much larger and cannot be interacted with.

docs.title: Unable to Add Channels
docs.text:
Solution:

• Make sure you have permissions to create channels. If you're the server owner, check your role settings. Try refreshing the page if the problem persists.

docs.title: Invite Links Not Working
docs.text:
Solution:

• Create a new invite link and double-check the server settings for any invite restrictions. If using a custom link, make sure it's formatted correctly.

docs.title: Unable to Start an Activity
docs.text:
Solution:

• Check if you have the right permissions within the server to start activities. Server owners or admins can adjust these settings.

• Sometimes, changing the server's region can fix the problem.

docs.title: Can't See or Join the Activity
docs.text:
Solution:

• Make sure you're in the same voice channel where the activity started.

• Check if the activity has a participant limit. Ensure it hasn't been reached.

docs.title: Unable to Upload Emoji or Sticker
docs.text:
Solution:

• Check the file size and format. Emojis should be under 256KB and in PNG, JPG, or GIF format. Stickers should be in PNG format and under 500KB.

• Make sure the "Manage Emojis" and "Manage Stickers" permissions are turned on for the roles that need them.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: This section will guide you through the process of creating your own server and inviting friends or classmates to join. By building your own server, you can have a private space for discussions, collaborations, or social gatherings online.

docs.title: Create Your New Server
docs.text: To begin with, you need to decide on the server's template and purpose, then customize it according to your purpose and preferences. Here’s how you’ll set everything up:

docs.title: 1. Choose Server Template
docs.text: Select a pre-defined Discord template or create a custom server. Discord provide templates for various needs such as Gaming, School Club, or Study Group.

docs.title: 2. Define Server Purpose
docs.text: Determine if the server is for a small circle of friends or a larger community. Skip this step if you are not sure for now.

docs.title: 3. Customize and Create Server
docs.text: Name your server and upload a representative photo. Finalize by clicking “Create”.

docs.title: Create channels: voice and text
docs.text: After creating your own server, you need to build channels based on specific needs.

docs.title: 4. Click to add channel
docs.text:
Click the dropdown arrow next to your Server name

In the dropdown menu, click on to create channel

docs.title: 5. Customize and Create Channel
docs.text: Decide whether your channel is text or voice channel. Name you channel and set whether it is private. Click “Create Channel ” to create the new channel

docs.title: Delete channels
docs.text: You can also delete unwanted channels.

docs.title: 6. Click the “EDIT” button
docs.text: Hover over the channel you want to delete, click the gear icon to access the channel settings.

docs.title: 7. Choose delete channel
docs.text: In the channel settings, find the bin icon and click on it.

docs.title: 8. Confirm
docs.text:
A confirmation window will appear. Click "Delete Channel" to delete the channel.

Warning

Your channel will be permanently deleted.

docs.title: Inviting People to Your Server
docs.text: After setting up, it's time to grow your community by inviting others:

docs.title: 9. Navigate to Invite Section
docs.text: Click the dropdown button next to the server name. In the drop-down menu, click the human icon to invite people.

docs.title: 10. Select and Send Invites
docs.text:
Choose to send direct invites or use a link. For multiple people invitation, a link is most efficient.

Success

By following these steps, you should have a fully functional server with your first members joining. Congratulations on creating your private digital space!

docs.title: Conclusion
docs.text:
In this section, you learned how to:

  • Create a server tailored to your needs
  • Invite friends or classmates to join your server

You've taken the first step towards building your online community. Great work!

docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
In this user guide, you will learn how to host group voice and video chats on Discord, specifically focusing on starting an activity to watch YouTube videos together.

By the end of this guide, you'll be equipped with the knowledge to initiate and enjoy collaborative activities with your friends on Discord.

docs.title: Host Group Voice & Video Chat
docs.text:
1. Go to Discord's website and pick a server from the list on the left.

Note

Your server lists may have different looks.

  1. Select a channel with the microphone icon , click on the name of the channel to join a voice chat.

docs.title: 3. Start Voice or Video Chatting
docs.text:
Start talking and adjust your microphone and camera settings if needed. 🗣️

Note

Toggle your microphone and camera on/off as needed using the microphone and camera icons.

docs.title: 4. Start an Activity
docs.text: Begin an activity by clicking the rocket icon on your server tab or main chat screen.

docs.title: 5. Authorize and Start
docs.text:
Allow any on any pop-up windows if prompted by clicking 'Authorize', then 'Got It'.

Optional

Have your friends join the Activity. To join, they need to be in the same Voice Channel as you and join the Activity you started. Each person joining the game will need to provide authorization if they’ve never played the chosen Activity before.

docs.title: 6. Select YouTube
docs.text: Choose 'YouTube' from the activity list and wait for it to load.

docs.title: 7. Add Video to Playlist
docs.text:
Select a video to watch with your friends and click to add it to the playlist.

Note

Selected videos will automatically play upon selection, and multiple videos can be added to a playlist.

docs.title: 8. Expand Video
docs.text: Hover over the video window and click 'Expand Video' for better viewing. Enjoy watching the video together with your friends!

docs.title: 9. Leave Activity
docs.text: Click on the red door icon when done to exit the activity or start another. videos or wish to start another activity, You'll return to the voice chat interface.

docs.title: 10. Leave Voice Channel
docs.text: Click the phone icon to leave the voice channel.

docs.title: Conclusion
docs.text:
Congratulations! You have successfully learned how to host group voice and video chats on Discord by starting an activity to watch YouTube videos together. With the knowledge gained from this guide, you can now enjoy collaborative activities with your friends while using Discord's features.

Success

You have mastered streaming videos with friends on Discord, enhancing your group's online hangouts and creating memorable experiences together.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Enhance your server’s user engagement by creating customized stickers and emojis. This section will walk you through creating these elements and enabling others in your server to contribute as well.

docs.title: Access Emoji and Sticker Management Panel
docs.text: Initially, navigate to the emoji and sticker management panel within Server Setting:

docs.title: 1. Open Server Settings
docs.text:
Next to the Server name, click the downward arrow to expand the dropdown menu.

Select "Server Settings" from the menu.

docs.title: 2. Select Emoji or Stickers
docs.text: From the server settings sidebar, click on “Emoji” or “Stickers” depending on what you want to manage.

docs.title: Manage and Use Emojis and Stickers
docs.text: You can create new or edit existing emojis and stickers with the following instructions:

docs.title: 3. Add New Emoji
docs.text: Click “Upload Emoji”, select your image, and press enter to upload.

docs.title: 4. Edit Emoji
docs.text: To edit, hover over an emoji in the list and double-click to change its name.

docs.title: 5. Delete Emoji
docs.text: To delete, click the red “X” next to the emoji you want to remove.

docs.title: 6. Add New Sticker
docs.text: Click “Upload Sticker”, choose the file, give your sticker a name and description, then click “Upload”.

docs.title: 7. Edit Stickers
docs.text: To edit, hover over a sticker in the list. You will see a pen icon . Click it to edit the sticker.

docs.title: 8. Delete Stickers
docs.text: To delete, click the “X” next to the sticker you want to remove.

docs.title: 9. Send Emoji or Sticker
docs.text: Click the emoji or sticker icon in the message input area, select from your available emojis or stickers, and send it in chat.

docs.title: Enable Collaborative Creation
docs.text: Allow friends to contribute their own emojis and stickers:

docs.title: 10. Modify Roles in Server
docs.text: Return to “Server Settings”, select “Roles”, then click on the default permission role.

docs.title: 11. Enable Creative Expressions Permissions
docs.text:
Search for “Create Expressions”, and enable it by changing the default “x” to a check mark, allowing members to create emojis and stickers.

[PCTURES HERE!!!!!]

Success

You have successfully added customized emojis and stickers to your server and enabled others to contribute. Enjoy the creativity!

docs.title: Conclusion
docs.text:
By following this guide, you have now learned how to:

  • Add and manage customized Server emojis and stickers.
  • Enable friends to make their own emojis and stickers.

Congratulations on customizing your server and building a more engaging and creative community!
